channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump signs order ending union bargaining rights for wide swaths of federal employees

item.title: Israel strikes a Beirut suburb, saying it was targeting a Hezbollah drone depot
item.description: The attack came as cross-border fire has escalated between Israel and militants in Lebanon, raising doubts about the state of a shaky ceasefire.

item.title: 3/28: CBS Morning News
item.description: Powerful 7.7 magnitude earthquake hits Myanmar; Elon Musk responds to concerns over Social Security and DOGE.

item.title: Feb 21: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: Netanyahu vows to make Hamas pay for failing to return body of Israeli hostage Shiri Bibas; Navy seeks new generation of workers to build submarines.

item.title: Colleges rely on federal research funding. Under Trump, its future is in doubt
Putin floats idea of UN-led government in Ukraine
item.description: The move is seen as an attempt to challenge the legitimacy of the current authorities in Kyiv.

item.title: Under-fire Zimbabwe president names new army chief
item.description: It comes ahead of planned protests by a group of war veterans who want Emmerson Mnangagwa to resign.

item.title: What is the Alien Enemies Act of 1798 and how is Trump using it?
item.description: President Trump's use of the Alien Enemies Act of 1798​ to deport alleged Venezuelan gang members kicked off a legal battle.​

item.title: Bridge collapses into river in Mandalay, Myanmar
item.description: Video shows damage to the Ava Bridge, near Mandalay, after a 7.7-magnitude earthquake rocked central Myanmar.

item.title: State of emergency declared in Myanmar after huge earthquake
item.description: The quake hit central Myanmar with strong tremors felt as far as south-west China and Thailand.

item.title: Residents describe horror in aftermath of earthquake in Myanmar
item.description: A resident of Myanmar's largest city Yangon tells the BBC tremors lasted around four minutes.
